decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells in order to deal damage as quickly as possible. It has a low mana curve to ensure fast plays and utilizes cards that allow for card draw and manipulation to maintain momentum. The deck aims to efficiently use every resource available to deal damage and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to apply early pressure, while spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment help finish off the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory to pump up creatures and give them additional abilities. The goal of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures, spells, and combat tricks.

The deck focuses on utilizing Amulet of Vigor to ramp up mana production and take advantage of Primeval Titan's ability to search for lands. By using cards like Gruul Turf, Scapeshift, and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to quickly assemble powerful land combinations to generate substantial mana and overwhelm opponents with large creatures. The inclusion of Aftermath Analyst and Malevolent Rumble provides additional utility and disruption, while cards like Explore and Arboreal Grazer help to keep the deck running smoothly and ensure consistency in executing its combos.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo pieces needed to generate massive amounts of mana and flood the board with powerful Eldrazi creatures. The key strategy involves using cards like Ancient Stirrings and Kozilek's Command to search for key combo pieces like Devourer of Destiny and Emrakul, the Promised End. By utilizing cards like Blade of the Bloodchief and Malevolent Rumble to empower your creatures, along with lands like Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple to ramp up your mana production, you can overwhelm your opponent with a flurry of Eldrazi creatures and powerful synergies.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing small creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck includes synergy between creatures like Ragavan and Galvanic Discharge, as well as ways to pump up creatures with cards like Guide of Souls and Ocelot Pride. Additionally, the deck includes control elements like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells to secure a fast victory.

The deck focuses on using aggressive Boros creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It utilizes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Seasoned Pyromancer to apply early pressure and finish off the opponent with powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Voice of Victory. The deck also includes removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to clear the way for its creatures. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to consistently curve out and put pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategies and maintain control of the board through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and hand disruption cards. With cards like Thoughtseize, Counterspell, and Fatal Push, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently answering threats. In addition, the deck includes powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to close out the game. Overall, this deck focuses on controlling the pace of the game and outlasting the opponent through efficient card advantage and removal.

The key concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Ephemerate, and Solitude to disrupt their hand and board state, while also deploying efficient threats like Flickerwisp and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, you can control the pace of the game and overwhelm your opponent. The deck's strategy revolves around disrupting your opponent's resources and tempo, while maintaining a strong board presence to close out the game quickly.

The main idea of this combo Modern deck is to quickly cycle through cards using cards like Ardent Plea, Street Wraith, and Generous Ent to fill up the graveyard with creatures. Once there are enough creatures in the graveyard, the player can cast Living End to reanimate all of their creatures at once, overwhelming the opponent. Cards like Subtlety and Force of Negation provide protection and disruption, while Curator of Mysteries and Waker of Waves offer additional value. The deck aims to win by setting up a powerful board state with a single well-timed Living End.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana for powerful colorless spells and Eldrazi creatures. It utilizes control elements such as removal spells and hand disruption to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Thought-Knot Seer to control the battlefield. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big, hard-to-answer threats and lock them out of the game with powerful spells like All Is Dust. Its key strength lies in its ability to quickly establish a dominant board presence and control the game.

This deck focuses on using Allosaurus Rider and Eldritch Evolution to quickly assemble powerful threats such as Griselbrand, Ghalta, and Atraxa. The deck runs a variety of tutor effects like Summoner's Pact and Neoform to find the necessary combo pieces. Consign to Memory and Planar Genesis provide additional value and synergy with the deck's strategy. Generous Ent and Xenagos, God of Revels can provide additional pump to the creatures for a lethal attack. The deck also includes Pact of Negation for protection to ensure the combo can successfully go off.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy involves playing efficient and powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while also utilizing burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to deal direct damage to the opponent or remove threats from the board. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory to provide additional support and buffs to the creatures. The goal is to keep the pressure on the opponent and win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of powerful spells and creatures to quickly assemble a win condition without relying on traditional lands. By taking advantage of cards like Hydroelectric Specimen, Lotus Bloom, and Whir of Invention, the deck aims to generate enough mana to cast a devastating spell like Goblin Charbelcher or Tameshi, Reality Architect. Disrupting Shoal and Force of Negation provide protection while Sink into Stupor and Thundertrap Trainer disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a unique and efficient combo strategy.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands - Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Tower - to quickly ramp up mana and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and colorless spells. It utilizes control elements such as Thought-Knot Seer and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt opponents' strategies while generating advantage through cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms. The deck aims to establish board dominance with potent threats while maintaining control over the game through a combination of removal, disruption, and high-impact spellcasting.

The main concept of this deck is to use the combination of Allosaurus Rider and Neoform to quickly search for and play powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Ghalta, and Atraxa. The deck focuses on utilizing various spells and creatures to generate mana and card advantage in order to set up a game-winning board state in a fast and efficient manner. The inclusion of cards like Pact of Negation and Boseiju, Who Endures helps protect key combos and provide additional utility in the deck. The overall goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and combo plays.

This deck is focused on quick and aggressive plays, utilizing a variety of different colored lands and spells to overwhelm the opponent. It combines powerful creatures with efficient removal spells and counters to control the board and apply pressure. The key strategy is to use cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu to deal damage quickly, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Stubborn Denial and Leyline Binding. The deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.
